intro: Linanthus nuttallii subsp. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, pubescent stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
